/Lotus/Language/1999Texting/EleanorRoman: Happy Birthday to the firstborn of the Nightingale family!
Happy Birthday, monster lady!
Happy Birthday, Eleanor. I’m glad you’re still here.
Congratulations on surviving to another birthday!
Happy Birthday, Eleanor! Hope you’re enjoying it!
… so is it hard to blow out birthday cake candles with that tongue of yours getting in the way?
Of course, I meant it.
Honestly? I've thought about it some more. And, no. I'd have to stop you if you became a monster.
[Ignore.]
The line between "hero" and "monster" is blurrier than most people like to admit. I've fought against Grineer and Corpus and fought alongside them.
Because I think you're one of the most fiercely intelligent, wonderfully sardonic people I've ever met. I don't even think the Techrot could take that away from you.
I don't believe in the words "Good" and "Evil." Just people. Why do you have any less of a right to exist than I do? I might not have a Techrot tongue, but I'm just as much of a freak of nature.
The Indifference was unleashed by Entrati. A man. Human hubris was to blame for that.
Protecting people from death is not the same thing as believing something should be exterminated or has no right to exist.
Ensuring a flock of sheep doesn't get eaten by wolves is not the same as going out and murdering all the wolves for being evil.
We don't really know where the Techrot came from. It could be manmade. It could be from something else entirely.
The simple fact is, you don't want me to kill you. So I wouldn't. I'd let you go.
How do I know nothing of Eleanor remained? You talk about how the Techrot thinks. How it talks to you. It's clearly intelligent.
It seems to be a hive mind. Maybe Eleanor would still be in there, not in one place, but a billion. Who am I to say that's "wrong?"
No. I couldn't.
Yes. If the Techrot really is unnatural? Then... it has to go.
Because I have feelings for you. [Confess feelings.]
Because you mean too much to me as a friend.
Asking me if I'd kill you is just *cruel,* Eleanor. When the thought of you dead, or in pain, just --
Asking me if I'd kill you is just *cruel,* Eleanor.  You're my friend. You're like family to me.
The fact of the matter is? No. I couldn't. Because the hope that you'd exist somewhere out there? In some form? Anywhere? Would be enough for me.
The fact of the matter is? No. I couldn't. Because the hope that you'd exist somewhere out there? In some form? Anywhere? Would be enough for me.
I'm sorry. I can't do this. I need to go.
I'm sorry. I can't do this. I need to go.
I really just wanted to apologize for the terrible things I said.
I just wanted to tell you that I have feelings for you.
I think he was "punking" you.
I have no idea.
Maybe I've been confused on how this all works.
I would love that.
Eh, no. Never mind.

보이드는 내 부모님을 미치게 만들었어.
얼마만큼인지도 모르는 시간 동안, 보이드는 내 집이었어. 내게 맞춰 스스로 형태를 바꿨지. 혹은 어떻게 해서든 내가 직접 빚어냈거나. 정확히 무슨 일이 일어났는지는, 아직도 잘 모르곘어.

잠깐. 잠깐.

내 말은, 난 이제 워프레임이잖아. 아니, 프로토프레임인가, 그들과 비슷한 거고.
그리고 능력을 쓸 수 있지. 정신 조종이라던가, 뇌 과부하.
내 안에서 나오는 힘이 거기서 나오는 거라고? 보이드?
잠깐만, 마음 좀 가라앉히고 있어.
좋아. 하던 얘기 마저 해. 더 듣고 싶어 견딜 수가 없으니.
그렇다면 말이지.
내가 사는 시간에 데이모스의 심장이 없다면, 보이드는 어떻게 나한테까지 닿고 있는 걸까?
왜냐하면 알다시피, 내가 느낄 수 있으니까. 분명 느낄 수 있어.
'마법'이라는 단어만으론 너무 모자라게 느껴지는걸.
네가 설명하는 건 신의 힘에 가까운 거야.
어떤 느낌이니? 전염병이 가득한 도시를 유유자적 돌아다니면서도, 병에 걸릴 걱정 따윈 안 해도 되는 자유가 있다는 게.
충고 고맙지만, 난 내 좋을 대로 말할 거란다.
어머, 그럴 리가.
네가 하는 걸 봐 왔거든. 너도 한때 인간이었을지는 모르지만, 이제는 우주 엘프 스팽글리부츠 같은 거잖니. 그 온갖 귀신 나올 것 같은 빛무리며 신비한 힘들.
네가 죽을 수 있다고 생각 안 해. 적어도 영원히는. 그리고 사람들이 죽기 위해 얼마나 노력했는지, 나는 알지.
좋아. 알았다고. 미안해.
이 엘레노어가 오늘은 좀 레몬처럼 시큼하단다.
솔 맙소사, 그 시큼한 레몬 맛마저도 그립네.
넌 테크병을 무서워하는 척조차 하지 않아. 왜 하겠어? 무서울 이유가 없는데.
어차피 걸리지 않을 테니까.
뭐 자랑이라고 인정할 만한 건 아니구나.
하지만 어쨌든, 물어봐 줘서 고마워.
하. 그게 엔트라티의 전매특허였지. 그가 처음으로 그놈의 '닥터 프라이데이' 의학 쇼인지 뭔지에 출연헀던 시절.
모르겠지. 그리고 추측할 입장도 아니야, 실은.
그냥 네가 그렇게 모든 것을 초월한 양 있는 게 억울하고 분한 것 뿐이라고, 알아들어?
아, 세상에. 이제야 기억났어. 에리스. 그 선체들. 데이모스의 지표.
테크병을 상대론 이길 수 없다는 걸 자꾸만 잊어버리게 되는구나.
...그냥 무시하렴. 비어져 나오는 오점만으로도 추하기 그지없는데, 자기 연민은 더 추악하니까.
왜 그자 본인은 감염되지 않았는지 궁금해지긴 하는군. 그의 가족들도 결국은 다 당했는데.
적어도 그자는 흡수되지 않고 스스로를 지켜냈더구나. 네가 아는 것보다 너와 더 비슷할지도 모르겠어.
그래서 자꾸만, 우리가 여기서 하려는 일이 의미없게 느껴져. 거의.
솔 맙소사. 난 지금 역병에 희생된 내가 가여운 나머지 나머지 면역이 있다는 이유만으로 네게 울분을 쏟아붓고 있는데, 넌 온 세상이 바로 그 똑같은 쓰레기 오물에 잡아먹히는 걸 봐야 했겠구나.
홀바니아엔 참 구세주 지망생들이 많기도 해.
옛날엔 공주님, 그 다음엔 엔트라티. 빅토르. 물론 내 남동생도 있지. 그리고 이젠 너고.
넌 스스로를 영웅이라고 생각하니?
내 상황이 얼마나 나은지부터 생각을 해 봐야 할 것 같아.
그래, 그거면 됐지. 계속 힘내렴, 병사님.
그 동화 속 왕국에 갇혀 있다 와서도 어쩌면 이렇게 아직까지 철이 안 들고 그런 걸 붙잡고 있는지. 그냥 이해 자체를 할 수가 없구나.
다행이네, 너만큼 오랜 세월을 살아온 사람이라면 지금쯤은 좀 어른스러워졌어야 맞지.
잘 됐구나. 난 똑똑히 봤거든. 어린 소년 하나가 영웅의 길을 걷자고 길을 나서더니, 자기를 뺀 나머지 사람들이 자기를 위한 조역이라고 생각하기 시작하면 어떤 일이 일어나는지.
Let’s get this straight. Lettie doesn’t think I’m sick. Lettie thinks I’m a demon.
I wonder what it’s like to have such a romantic view of the world. You’d think a medic would deal in measurable facts. Ten CC of this, identify the microbes of that.
It’s not unpleasant, which is more than you can say for most parasitic infestations.
I can feel the Technocytes swimming in my blood. If I close my eyes I can see sparkles like fairy dust.
Have you heard what she calls me?

Yep. She sits there smirking with her phials and potions, her bottles of blood and slivers of skin, her army of ratty familiars skittering all over the place, and she has the temerity to call ME a witch.
‘La Bruja Metiche’. The nosy witch. I suppose she could do far worse, considering her vocabulary and flair for creative obscenities.
It means me well. Can you understand that?
I have heard her tell Quincy to do some rather inventive things with playground fixtures and parts of his anatomy that left me chuckling over the visual for some time, I must admit.

Yet she sits there smirking with her phials and potions, her bottles of blood and slivers of skin, her army of ratty familiars skittering all over the place, and she has the temerity to call ME a witch.

Everything it does, it does out of a sincere wish to fix me up and make me better. If I’m quick and lethal and hard to kill, I’ll be a good host. So it fulfills its part of our symbiotic bargain by giving me shark skin and wolf fangs, along with a tongue like a leather whip.
Well, yes. Living the way we do, how could one not believe in the spiritual world?
I’m still Eleanor Nightingale. That’s more important to me than being ‘human’ is.
Don’t get me wrong. I WOULD piss on her if she was on fire.
I think you can guess the answer to that.
I know. Sometimes I do, too. I have a recurring nightmare where I rip her throat out just as she puts a bullet through my heart.
I’ve seen what human beings are capable of. We’re not special. In fact, going by what I’ve seen in your head, we get even worse over time.
But I’d take my time over it.
But being afraid of something doesn’t make it real. So far I have gone on zero bloody rampages. ZERO.
Amir’s caused more sodding injuries than I have.
But Amir is sweet and a bit ditzy, isn’t he? Amir doesn’t have teeth that could gnaw open a tin of rations. So nobody sees Amir as a bomb waiting to go off.
Well. Except Quincy.

The Void is proof positive that the spiritual is just as real as the material. All your people have done, aside from putting a different name on it, is develop a reliable means of getting there and back.
Listen. Just because I admit the existence of demonic forces doesn’t mean I’m content to be written off as one.
I never said that.
As opposed to following the agenda of a twisty little double helix of nucleotides? You know, that thing humans have done since they started walking upright?

The likes of Viktor Vodyanoi - and what kind of sobriquet is THAT to choose for yourself - justify their backward views by claiming they are ‘natural’. Biological fundamentalism. Man as the mirror of the Divine and all of that.
Some people think humanity is sacred. People like Viktor. I’m the ultimate blasphemy in his eyes. Infected, shameless and female.
“Me not do bidding of microscopic tyrant! Me human being. Me special! Find mate. Reproduce. Protect territory. Ug.”
But we’ve been unnatural from the moment we started banging rocks together. Language is a virus, mate. Being human is the blank slate we get to scribble on, not the primal Eden we were kicked out of.

What’s happening in my system is the result of quite mundane atoms and molecules waltzing together in unexpected and remarkable ways. Any spiritual significance to that will be imparted by me. Not Lettie.
Don’t get me wrong. I WOULD piss on her if she was on fire.
I think you can guess the answer to that.
I know. Sometimes I do, too. I have a recurring nightmare where I rip her throat out just as she puts a bullet through my heart.
But I’d take my time over it.
But being afraid of something doesn’t make it real. So far I have gone on zero bloody rampages. ZERO.
Amir’s caused more sodding injuries than I have.
But Amir is sweet and a bit ditzy, isn’t he? Amir doesn’t have teeth that could gnaw open a tin of rations. So nobody sees Amir as a bomb waiting to go off.
Well. Except Quincy.
I mean… yes. You’re right. There are parasites that do that.
But what if it’s not a parasite? What if it’s a symbiote?
And what’s so bloody wonderful about being an unabsorbed moon? Why is the Infested version not an improvement?
Oh no! A lump of indifferent space rock that could have drifted aimlessly for another few millennia is suddenly alive and interesting! What a catastrophe!
It’s the exact same bullshit Viktor’s crew come out with. Sentimental clinging on to whatever something USED to be.
As if being primordial was the same as being perfect.
Remind me, what are your Warframes made of again?
You think I don't?
Do you have any idea what it takes to keep the rage in check? Do you know what the price of this outward serenity is?
If you see me meditating, I'm not communing with the great cosmic cabbage. I'm cooling down the sodding reactor core.
But their Infestation was shaped and controlled, wasn’t it?
Just like the Infestation that’s in me now.
There's SO much I could do and DON'T. Places I could take this... stuff... that you haven't even considered.
Which means someone, somewhere had the guts to stop thinking of the Infestation as a brainless monster and start looking at what it could become.
I could walk into their DREAMS. And they wouldn't even know I'd been there.
Well. This has been an interesting, if uncouth, exchange of views. I had a lovely time. Let's do it again.
You know, you’re getting quite emotional. We should finish this conversation another time.

The last time I got hit with a biochemical sledgehammer that left me sprawled on a couch for half the day and had people whispering behind my back that I was turning into a monster, it was called ‘puberty’.
Long story.
Idyllic. We never fought, not even once. We kept one another’s secrets. He even let me braid his hair.
No wonder everyone else is jealous of me and wants Arthur to be their brother, too.
Later, assuming you haven't skipped town and I haven't mutated into a raging shapeless wad of muscle tissue and mouths.
Perhaps, once I’m sure you won’t go running back and forth between Arthur and me, comparing notes.
Because you might learn things about certain people that you might find hard to stomach.
I can’t imagine he’s opened up to you much.
Aren't I cryptic? Like a Sphinx. Rarr.
Actually, he did do that. Until quite recently, in fact.
I wish he would wear eyeliner more often. He claims it’s too much of a faff. Prefers burnt cork.
Arthur thinks there are some things you shouldn’t talk about. He’s old-fashioned like that. ‘Bad for morale’, he’ll say. ‘Camp chatter.’ ‘Careful, might be circulating enemy propaganda.’
Oh, it runs deep in our family.
Which is just what I want.

The smudgy dark-eyed look does suit him, but he doesn’t know when to stop with the eyeshadow. He tries to be a moody stubble god, all folded arms and 2am bus stops, but then he keeps going and ends up as a hungover emo panda. And he wonders why people don’t take him seriously.
That is entirely your prerogative and I will not judge you for your choice
I will even wish you happy hunting, if you are so inclined
HOW DARE YOU
Do not disparage the sacred ritual that is Doing One Another's Makeup
HOWEVER
We are not even close to being well enough acquainted for that.
If I suspect FOR ONE INSTANT that you are using anything I choose to share with you as leverage to get into his armoured pants...
... I will be every inch the monster people think I am, for long enough to make you wish you were back in the execution circus.
Sorry, let me just catch my breath a moment.
... I'm not saying never. Okay? And it only just occurred to me that this might be the first time, for you.
So I'll give you a pass, this once. But in all seriousness, it's not the sort of thing to joke about.
It meant a lot for Arthur to trust me like that. It meant even more that I was able to make him feel genuinely good about himself.
Blimey. I feel like owe you an apology now, and I don't really do those.
Let's chalk this one up to experience, eh?

Dad used to have an old Army poster from the ‘37 Bombardment on the wall in the downstairs loo. A square-jawed loyal soldier is punching out a scrawny moaner whose glasses go flying off. Caption: “Slap the chap who flaps his trap with crap!”
Arthur loved it because it was ‘rude’. He took its lesson to heart, though. ‘Don’t talk about things that could hurt the people we care about.’
Precisely. It's all very well and good until it's being invoked to shut you up.
All very well until it’s being invoked to shut you up.
All my life there have been things we NEEDED to talk about. There are conversations we SHOULD have had. Granny Callie. Christopher. The Cavona Mansion. They festered between us.
But no. Talking about it was Simply Not Done. Too much at stake.

So because the alternative was never to feel clean in my own skin again, I made it my business to find out about other things that people didn’t want talked about, and I talked about them. I wrote about the kinds of things that soon had people trying to nudge my car over the edge of a Hibernian mountain pass.

The usual stuff. Corruption at the highest levels of government. Paternity scandals in the Höllvanian royal family. Tainted milk powder being distributed to nursing mothers in ‘undesirable’ sink estates in New Holywell.

Right, yes. Tourist to our time. The usual stuff. Corruption at the highest levels of government. Paternity scandals in the Höllvanian royal family. Tainted milk powder being distributed to nursing mothers in ‘undesirable’ sink estates in New Holywell.
Because when someone tells you to shut up, you do not comply, EVER.
I assume that’s a good thing? Tell me about her some time when I’m not in the mood to rip someone’s head off.
Anyway. Arthur wanted me to shut up, for the good of the family. Now I don’t talk at all. Yet for some reason Arthur’s still not happy.
I ask you. What is a sister to do?
Okay, we’ve known each other a little while now, and you’re from the future, and I think I can trust you to be honest with me about this, so I have to ask the most important question.
Are we alone? Or did we finally contact something else?
Well, shit.
What IS ‘the Indifference’? I’ve seen glimpses in your mind, but I can’t make sense of it. It makes me want to run and curl up somewhere far away with very thick walls.
The bleakest possible answer.
I was really hoping there’d be something out there we could talk to. Something with a truly outside perspective on our species.
I’m not sure why. Intelligence is intelligence, after all. It shouldn’t matter whether we discover it or create it.
Talk to and… other things, of course.
Oh.
Excuse you. I am not a 'tentacle monster'. I am a monster who happens to have A TENTACLE. One. So far.
Some kind of communion, I suppose. Not necessarily anything physical. I just want to touch minds with something that not only isn’t human, it isn’t even terrestrial.
If all I wanted to do was converse with things with tentacles, I'd pop over to the Princess Lucina Zoological Gardens and make friends with the octopus.
I tried to touch minds with one of Lettie’s rats, once, just to see what would happen.
... and now I'm wishing I'd done that. Octopi are highly intelligent. We'd probably be writing poetry together by now. I wonder where that octopus is?
It was a dreadful three seconds for him.
Someone probably ate it. That's what usually happens to zoo animals in quarantined cities, once supplies run out.
And whatever didn't get eaten will be riddled with Techrot by now.
... which is how it was in the 'dream', isn't it? Only it isn't a dream at all. It happened. Or will happen. Or a version of it will. Something happens at that zoo.
I'm going to remember as much as I can.
Don't try to stop me.

Poor little thing. I’d failed to allow for what touching MY mind would seem like to HIM, you see. Imagine a child lost in an infinite department store, screaming for its mother at the top of its lungs over and over. Everything was enormous and incomprehensible and had NOISES and SHAPES instead of SMELLS.
I broke the link as fast as I could. He was a little dizzy for an hour or so, then he was fine. I doubt he even remembers what happened to him.
I wouldn’t let Lettie hear you say that. Not if you like your organs where they are.
I don’t know if you’ve ever had the kind of slump where all you want to do is lie in bed and breathe in and out and just exist without doing anything else, but it was a lot like that.
Very basic. Simple needs met in simple ways.
Childhood innocence has nothing on rat-consciousness.

Oh, it was. I’m sure being a rat has its bad side, like having to eat your dead brother so the predators won’t sniff him out, but that fleeting moment of simplicity was like a religious breakthrough, almost.
Sort of.
I guess being a rat is a lot like being a monk. Live off scraps, make your humble way in the world, never own a car or a house.
I just think there’s something heroic about being small and simple with very few needs.
I thought about being a nun for a long time, believe it or not.
Right, yes. It seems they don't have them where you come from.
Right. Perhaps they don’t have them where you come from.

Like a devotee of Lua. Shaven head, white or black robes depending on the Aspect, very strict life. You’re expected to focus on holy things to the exclusion of all else. Prayer and meditation every day. Basic diet.
It does, on the face of it. About the only difference between the monastic life and prison is that you’re doing it on purpose.
It sounds amazing to most young novices, too, until they actually get a taste of the monastic life. I think the quit rate is something like eighty per cent.
Oh, no. I mean, at first, yes, you’d need to wean yourself off all of the things that society has taught you to need. That phase is probably the hardest.
It wasn’t for me, either. It turns out I enjoy living in the world far too much.

A journalist is someone who hunts down interesting things that are happening in the world and tells other people about them, either by writing or making a broadcast of some sort. Usually both.

I tried to make a difference with my work. Yes, I was getting paid for it, but I wanted to do good in the world, too.
I was younger then, of course. Nothing cures you of the drive to 'do good in the world' than spending some time in it.
This is where it got me. Literally. I only came here to Höllvania in the first place because of the story.
Sorry. Sidetracked. Need to rant. Are you up for listening to me sound off about a pet hate of mine?
Ok. Don't say I didn't warn you. I have a theory I call the Hero Virus.

Oh, he was here first. But he made the mistake of telling me what was happening here, and I couldn’t sit on it. So I place a call to my old friend Danny MacIlvoy and pay over the odds for a forged visa and passport. Because I need them in a hurry.

You have to understand: they were locking Höllvania down, but they couldn’t do it all at once. This may be a walled city-state that’s been here since the time of the Radiant Khan, but the walls they put up to fend her off are old now and the powers in charge couldn’t get barricades and checkpoints up in time.
Just imagine for a moment that you can have a virus that's transmitted through stories. Like all viruses it wants to take over the host and spread itself further.
People were falling over themselves to get out. So nobody paid much attention to one stupid Britannic girl who was trying to get in.
The Hero Virus makes you see the world as if it were a story. It persuades you that Good is all about INDIVIDUAL PEOPLE doing AWESOME THINGS
You want to know the worst part?
So naturally you want to be one of those people
Oh, and we suddenly become squeamish?
Pardon me for upsetting your delicate sensibilities. Never mind, then.
Okay. Here is the worst part.

I was investigating an outbreak of what was being called Testudo Syndrome. Testudo because it means turtle, and people who had it were developing tough patches on their skin as an early marker. The same sort of thing that eventually turns into armour plating in us lucky few.

Testudo Syndrome was a treatment-resistant disease that seemed to be exclusive to Höllvania, had some enigmatic and sinister connection to computers, and appeared all at once. And people who asked too many questions about it had a tendency to end up as a clog in a Höllvanian sewer pipe.
No matter how tough it may be
Because a Hero has to make hard decisions. A Hero has to endure pain stoically.

Growths. Part organic, part technology, part some poor bastard’s delerium tremens. Light in the kind of colours people only see when they’ve inhaled too many solvent fumes. It’s hideous and I can’t take my eyes off it.

Not long after we all got the Entrati shots, I thought I had some kind of secondary bladder infection. Mate. I was up and down off that couch like a yo-yo. I even had Lettie hunting me down cranberry juice and mineral water.
Turns out I was just feeling six people’s natural biological urges. My nervous system naturally assumed they were mine.
Well, I AM catastrophically sick. Let's not mince words. But I'd rather be saddled with telepathy than never-ending cystitis.

I learned to build walls around my mind after that incident. Lettie sometimes finds meds that can shut the whole telepathic side of me down, just for a few hours. I have a stash of them, but I don’t take them unless I really, really need to sleep.
It’s such a useful talent to have, that’s the problem. Arthur insists on seeing it as a strategic asset.
It’s bloody awful for morale.
Even if I insist that I can control it, do you think they would believe me?
None of us is soft. We’re used to roughing it. This place is a five star hotel compared to a regular Britannic army barracks.
You shower together, you eat together, et cetera. You get used to one another. You have to.
But as Arthur would say, there’s a sodding limit.
I just don’t let them know how much of their inner lives I hear, see and feel. I don’t go probing uninvited, whatever Lettie might think.
Sometimes one of them will have a thought, and immediately think ‘did she hear me thinking that?' It's kinder to let them wonder. What they don’t know can’t hurt them.
Like I said, I’m not about to confirm or deny anything.
I should say, right about now, that there’s another important reason why I keep this shit to myself.

So. Arthur and me. We’re on the streets, raiding a Scaldra cache, and he’s seriously off his game. He’s not shooting straight, he’s driving like a drunk duck at the dodgems, he can’t even do the sword thing.

Naturally, I tell him to get his act together. Immediately he starts blaming ME. He tells me I’m always acting so superior, don’t I understand the pressure of command, if I had the first idea what he has to deal with on a DAILY basis I’d buckle, all this self-pitying bollocks.
Remember the Hero Virus I told you about?
I have this theory I call the Hero Virus.
Terminal case.

Little boys get it into their heads that the stories they've been fed are how the world really works. They think they are the hero and everything revolves around them.

Never mind.
I could feel how shocked and confused he was. He'd thought he was safe around me. Not anymore.
When we were little, some older boys stole Arthur’s favourite Action Angus and threw him on the Solstice bonfire.
I can still see him bent over and the flesh coloured plastic bubbling and dripping all over his camo trousers.
The boys laughed and said Arthur should be happy. Action Angus was going to the Hall of Heroes for the midwinter feast like warriors used to. I wanted to murder them. Little bastards.
Arthur didn’t want the boys to see him cry, and he didn’t want to cry in front of my dad, so the only person left was me. His shitty big sister.
I’m telling you about that because that’s where Arthur went, in his head. He remembered feeling like it was safe to cry in front of me if he ever really NEEDED to, and now?
Now it wasn’t safe any more.
It's horrible, isn't it? You get so used to the ritual of it, putting one another down, sniping and snarking...
It's comforting, almost. Then one day you draw blood and you can't take it back.

YES.
You GET IT. I love that! Fighting dirty.
You know that thing where you’re in an argument with someone and once it’s all over, you think of the exact right thing you should have said?
I don’t get that any more. I have a magic I Win button. All I’d have to do is look into their brain, grab whatever they’re most ashamed of and rub it in their face.
And I CAN’T DO IT, no matter how much I want to. Because I’m supposed to be a ‘good person’.
Oh dear. That's what I get for parading my virtues, isn't it?
Sorry. I was expecting sympathy. But I'll take the reality check.
Thank you.

I just wanted someone else to understand. Honestly, I’m a little taken aback by how much you DO understand.
You didn’t have to listen. But I’m glad you did.
It’s a messed-up freakshow inside this skull of mine. I think you can appreciate why I don’t roll out the welcome mat to strangers.
I expect people to run away screaming. You haven’t. Yet. I wonder why. Thank you. Again. For everything.
Appreciate the talk.
Are you there? I need to talk.
Are you there? I need to talk to you about something. It’s serious.
Remember how I told you about how I tried to touch Rusalka’s mind with mine, and I made contact with The Indifference instead?
Thank you.
Do you understand what happened to Major Rusalka?
Right. I wasn’t ready to talk about it then. I’m ready now, if you’re willing.
‘The Indifference’. That’s what you call it?
Hollowed out, yes.
But whatever was driving her wasn't like you.
Anything human about it was like a mockery.
I’m sure.
This creature, this presence, is what we’re ultimately up against. I know that much now.
It was about as human as a store mannequin. In pieces.
Please tell me the truth. Do you believe there is any hope?
I touched it, you see. With my mind. I was trying to probe her, but she wasn't there.

Giving it a name feels like I’ve gotten a tiny bit of control back.
At least you were honest.

I reached out for Rusalka, and it was as if my fingers touched her face and went right through. The mask just collapsed.
I’ve touched that thing with my mind. I thought I’d be probing Rusalka’s mind, but… the outer layers just caved in like wet, spongy plasterboard and then I was immersed in it. Floundering.
Better than apathy. Better than meek surrender.
I could just really do with some right now.
What was underneath was like…
There’s a word. ‘Calenture.’ It’s a kind of madness that used to affect sailors. They’d become convinced that the green sea all around them wasn’t water at all, but green grass.
Ah, well. So it is. Even if we're stumbling onward through the dark, at least we have one another's company.
I'm ready.
They'd be compelled to jump from the ship down into the beautiful green meadows and go running across them. If a shipmate held them back, they’d fight.
I jumped, expecting grass. Next second I was in over my head in the freezing dark.
Well, shit.

There’s a feeling there isn’t a word for. You look out on the world and you just KNOW, that all the ordinariness - buildings, cars, people, jobs, work, routine - is just a thin crust over a bottomless horror, and if people ever realized it they’d start screaming and never stop.
I'd just about managed to psych myself up to this, and now, what? we're not mentioning the Devil in case it summons him?
I fell through the crust.
If you hear screaming in the night, it's me.
It wasn’t emptiness. I could have borne that. It went on and on forever, but it wasn’t just cold space. There was something in there with me.
I don’t know. But it knew I was there. It was AWARE of me. Like an elephant would be aware of a fly crawling across its eye.
I remember thinking ‘nothing that big should know I exist’.
It felt such utter disregard for me, such monumental indifference that I wanted to stop existing on the spot.
I think I could have coped if it had hated me. Then I would have had some value, some significance. But it saw me as meaningless, and I saw what it saw. I was a speck. A nothing.
Everything I had ever been, every tender moment, every laugh, every morsel of Eleanor Nightingale blew away in that storm.
It felt my light fading, and I swear, a tiny tremor of satisfaction went through it. As if it was pleased to have crushed me. A flea under its fingernail.
Did I?
It’s still out there, isn’t it?
But they will stop burning. One day. The heat death of the Universe.
Indifference wins in the end, my friend, no matter how many platitudes we throw into the abyss.
That’s the problem with not going mad. You’re cursed with clarity of thought.
You know what I’m talking about. You could have shattered like a sparrow’s egg or burnt your brain out with drugs until you felt nothing any more. And it would have hurt less than this… knowing.
I don’t understand why you haven’t walked away from this conversation yet.
FIGHT HOW
IS THAT ALL YOU AND ARTHUR CAN UNDERSTAND? FIGHTING?

YOUR ANSWER TO THE UNDERLYING MEANINGLESSNESS OF EXISTENCE IS 'FIND A WAY TO PUNCH IT?'

I care about you too, mate. We’re squadmates. We've been through a lot.

I’ve touched that thing with my mind. I thought I’d be probing Rusalka’s mind, but… the outer layers just caved in like wet, spongy plasterboard and then I was immersed in it. Floundering.
Spiffing. Just been shaving my tongue.
Shaving. These nobbly bits keep sprouting out of it. I think they used to be taste buds. If I don’t slice them off, they get really long and squirmy. Like a sea anemone.
It's really no different from trimming one's nails.
Sorry. I really should have warned you about this.
Messier, perhaps. But still nothing more than the paring back of an unwanted excrescence.
Everybody else knows to be at least a hundred yards away when Eleanor heads into the bathrooms with a kitchen knife and a bottle of surgical alcohol.

Just wait patiently and eventually I’ll come back out with blood all down my chin and a plastic bag of stuff like crab meat in my hand. I tried to turn the offcuts into burgers once but nobody wanted any.

All the time. It heals fast.

I do hate it when it gets in the way of my teeth, however. The one and only time I ever bit it off completely, it grew back. I'm stuck with this thing.
The one and only time I ever bit it off completely, it grew back. I’m stuck with this thing.
