I wouldn't have chosen it. But I don't hate it. It feels like it's always been there.
I miss the sound of my own voice. I hate that I can't sing any more.
But the tongue? You might find this hard to believe, but it's comforting sometimes. I'll never be unarmed ever again.
Yeah. It’s just that sometimes the reason is: an evil bastard did something evil.
So if you’re saying that everything always works out for the best, like there’s some great plan or purpose to it all, then you’re on your own. I don’t buy into that.
It’s hero virus stuff. You end up thinking you’re the main character in everyone else’s story.
There’s no great story here, mate. No author in the sky adding little plot beats to my life for dramatic effect.
I get to make meaning out of the stupid shit that happens to me. I’m the artist, not Sol or Lua or any of the stars in between.
You reminded me of that. I don’t know if you even remember. I was feeling sorry for myself and you snapped me out of it.
Gods, no. I’m saying that meaning is under the surface and it takes a sculptor’s chisel to get to it.
Some days it all feels bleak, horrible and hollow and I don’t want to get off the couch. But when I’m back to myself again, I know that feeling was a lie.
Nobody else holds the keys to meaning, you know? It’s a jam session between you and the universe. She throws stuff at you, you improvise around it.
It helps to focus on the parts of being semi-infested that I really like.
Feeling indestructible.
Only one? Have you MET Amir?
He has his dark moments, but that boy is an inspiration to us all.
Compared to mooching about with a face like a slapped arse, I'll take Amir's attitude any day.
Mind if I tell you a story?
When I was eighteen, a whole bunch of us had been out celebrating the end of the exams. We were all packed into this tiny car. Me lying across three people’s laps on the back seat.
Seb Cromley in the boot, whingeing. Christopher and Marco in the front. Every one of us was drunk off our arse on strawberry vodka and ratcatcher.
Marco ran a red light, a car coming the other way T-boned us, we rolled off the road and ended up in a ditch. I only know that because that’s what the policeman told me had happened.

They had to cut me out of the car. I wouldn’t stop screaming. It was the kind of hurt that leaves you with no crevice anywhere in yourself to crawl into to get away from it. You're being punished for existing.
I was helpless as a baby rabbit. Melted like a crayon. Gone. Just lay there and belted out scream after scream. I’d always thought of myself as a tough cookie before that.
Two days ago I was run over by a Scaldra APC.
That same old pain went flooding through me, but it wasn’t crippling any more. It was like fuel, revving me up, making me angry.
I picked myself up, relocated my shoulder and tore that APC open with my bare hands.
Agonizing, yes. But intoxicating.
So yeah, thanks for that much, Entrati. Wherever you are.
Okay. My head hurts thinking about it, but okay.

So there’s a child. A profoundly traumatized child. And someone thought it was a good idea to give this child weapons and armour and a selection of battle suits made from dead people, train them to kill, and send them off to war?
Tell me, after everything they’ve been through and are still going through, how is that child not catatonic in a hospital?
Caring? Empathy?
Of course. The Hero Virus. I should have known it would survive to your time.
Ugh. The Hero Virus.
Those poor kids were steeped in a myth, weren't they?
That's what I call the cycle of bullshit that starts with pretty stories and ends with young people willingly going to their deaths.
Trained to believe they were honourable warriors, not innocent catspaws?
No need to answer. I think I already know.
Arthur has it. Christopher had it.
Maybe I can develop a vaccine and save history.
Whatever the opposite of Indifference is, perhaps.
I wonder…
Nothing. Just an idea.
This is going to sound stupid, but please promise me something.
I know you’ve found a place here with us. I’m glad about that, truly.
All I ask is that you check on the child, if you can.
Hmm. I don't know.
They'd be no different to the Techrot if all they wanted to do was survive.
The way you talk about the kid, I'm not sure if I'm more scared for them or of them.
I think there's mercy in there, though. Some deep compassion. Maybe one day I'll see it for myself.
Okay. I just hope you're sure.
Because whatever they have inside them that can endure everything they went through and still feel empathy? We're going to need it.
I'm not sure that slaughtering thousands while carrying untold trauma is 'doing fine', frankly.
I'd want to know how they were coping.
Thank you. I admit, the idea of talking to an alternate version of yourself is exciting to me.
In fact, learning of your alternate version convinced me there must be another me out there somewhere who decided to become a nun. An apostle of Lua, shaven head, regular prayers, all of that.
I’ve been trying to make contact with her telepathically. If you can do it so can I, right?
Don't be such a spoilsport.
No. But I’m going to keep trying.
I mean if anyone’s going to have words of wisdom for me it’ll be the me who’s been devoting her life to spiritual things, no?
So stop me if I get any of this wrong:
You’ve got another self out there, walking around. That other self both is and isn’t you. They’re like a kid version of you from another version of reality.
Whoa Nelly. Hang on. Let me process that.
And I take it we are in THEIR reality, not yours. Let me... process that.
So… you’re like a guest star from a crossover episode and you got written into the show?
This is making my head spin. So what happened to your version of reality? Where’s it gone?
Then it lives on, in some sense.
You can’t just LOSE a whole cosmos. That’s insane. It has to be out there somewhere.
Ah! The lair of your friendly ghosts. The Holdfasts.
I'm sorry, that sounds fascinating but I have no idea what you're on about.
I can't imagine it's the kind of place you'd want to pop back to for a nostalgic stroll.
Ghost ship?
I can't begin to fathom what you've lost.
Hole between dimensions?
I don't know if that's any kind of a comfort.
But that’s your HOME. Don’t you want to get back there?
I can't imagine it's the kind of place you'd want to pop back to for a nostalgic stroll.
I can't begin to fathom what you've lost.
Huh. I’m oddly proud of that.
Maybe you just needed the right bunch of lethally stylish urban bio-commandos to associate with.
And proud of it, mate.
But getting back to the other version of you…
Ooh. Harsh.
Given how much you have in common, you might be a little kinder.
I love that she has children. Lethal space children.
I wonder if she'd let me be one? Do I get to be a Tenno?
No. I don't suppose I would, would I? I'm too old, for a start.
So here’s the part I don’t understand.
The kid is umpty-billion years old, but they spent most of that time in a freezer, so they’re still a kid, right?
Okay.
A. Child. Is. A Child.
Bear with me.
They don't conveniently turn into something else when they're mistreated.
Stop me immediately if this isn’t something you want to talk about.
The Zariman? What happened with your parents? This child has been through the same horrific ordeal you went through, right?
Hello, Drifter. I’m upset.
Two things.
I miss wine. I’ve not had real wine in so bloody long. All the wine in Höllvania got requisitioned by Scaldra command a few days into the outbreak.
Quincy and Arthur tried making prison hooch out of fruit ration sachets, but those of us who still had some dignity left said no. Rare moment of Lettie solidarity, that was.
The other thing, the much much bigger thing, is the future.
It’s not your fault, but… now that I’ve seen the future through your eyes I feel miserable in a way that the usual methods won’t shift.
I don't know. Maybe an exotic dance?
Spending the evening with Amir listening to him enthuse about whatever comic series or retro game he’s currently fixating on.
Describe Ballas's death to me in loving detail?
Surrounding myself with crystals and mentally chanting until Lettie calls the exorcist on me.
It's kind of you to offer, but I think this melancholy will just have to be borne.
This is a different kind of sad. It’s weighing me down like a soggy blanket.

Look, I was never really into science fiction. Arthur went through a phase, but he always preferred the gritty army stuff. Manly men being heroes, wholesome Stories for Boys, oodles of subtext, I’m sure you know the sort of thing.
Fine. Take me by the hand and walk me through the streets of Höllvania.

But I did know enough about science fiction to know that in the far far future, we are supposed to have our shit together. It’s meant to be all shiny and antiseptic. Robots do all the hard work, there’s no disease, nobody needs money, it’s all silver towers, blue skies and sexy lizards.
I know a place where we can grab some grated turnip cakes and watch the sun go down over the remains of a school.
Later we can sip cocktails by the light of a burning tank.
Well, all right. You get a point for that.
Ugh. I don’t… it’s complicated. Let me explain.
But did those robots make life any easier for ordinary people?
I’m not saying I expected the future to look like a children’s comic book. I just mean there was this optimism associated with it.

I think we all just took it for granted that however shitty things might be right now, we’d sort it out eventually. Our civilization is meant to progress. We started out smashing each other over the head with clubs and after a few thousand years we’d figured out ways to sort our differences out without doing that.
Or did they just become something else to take for granted?
Bingo. You’ve put your finger right on what I find so depressing about all this.
Precisely.
Obviously.
Right. That's what's so disappointing.
You had all this incredible, magical technology at your fingertips and all you did with it was find new ways to exploit each other. Science made us less equal, not more.
That's how you know what needs to be changed.
You're advanced, but you were meant to be ENLIGHTENED too
Thanks for bearing with me. I know it's a lot.
Oh Gods I don’t mean you personally. I mean your era.
If anything you went backwards. God-kings in the flesh! Of all the things to reinvent, you reinvented THEM.
No. I didn’t forget the part where the emotionally abused orphans murdered the immortal elite. I just love that bit. If I close my eyes I can almost imagine the screaming.
... is irony obsolete in the future too?
THEY HAVE DAD JOKES IN THE FUTURE
Happy now. Thank you.
Maybe I'll paint.
You know what the best thing about Höllvania was, back before the Scaldra took over?
Boo.
Oh Gods. Surgically beautiful people getting their immaculate faces off on untested drugs? No.
Look. I have nothing against watching a pair of sweaty blokes go at one another, hard. But no.
Good guess. You could get anything from a Bresslin handbag and glove combo to a human eyeball on ice. But no.
Well, of course you have no idea. You're a fresh-faced newcomer.
The bath houses!

I don’t know if they have anything like that where you are. They’re these temples, I suppose you’d call them, usually with a Sol set of rooms and a Lua set. You can soak in a public or a private pool. Everything smells herbal and steamy and it’s SO GOOD for getting your head back on straight.
Höllvania’s always had this hugely important tradition of ritual cleanliness. I guess it goes all the way back to the hot springs the city was built on.
All that ‘purity’ crap Viktor comes out with? He’s singing an age-old tune. All the citizens know where he’s coming from.
I used to love paying the extra Höllars to have a musclebound professional pound all the tension out of my muscles. You’d have loved it. I’m sure you would.
You'll strut about in a suit made from an Infested human body, but draw the line at massages?
Weird.
I knew you were my kind of squadmate.
I wish some of the others were a bit less uptight. Sadly, there was no way the bath houses could stay open after the outbreaks.
I’m sure you can guess. The Techrot wrecked so much. There was no way the bath houses could stay open after the outbreaks.

From what I’ve seen, some of them are basically spawning pools now. It breaks my heart, to tell you the truth. I remember finding thousand-year-old marble and mosaic floors carpeted over with creeping flesh.
Do you have anything like that in your time?
So what do people do to unwind?
Sounds like Amir making sound effect noises to himself...
Stockbrokers?
Komi? Black and white counters? The wedding-war of Sol and Lua?
Dad and Arthur used to watch the wrestling together every Saturday night.
But they're your enemies, aren't they? Or is there some kind of truce when it comes to team sports?
Old? It's SACRED! But also fun. A wonderful combination.
Everything's about the same two essential principles, you know? Mind and body. Symbol and meaning. Sol and Lua.
Arthur and I used to play Komi every year at Solstice. Why did we ever stop?
Slip him some Rathuum tapes if you get the chance. I think he'd love it.
What am I saying? Of course there is. That's just how people are.
I have to ask you something and I don’t think you’re going to like it. I think you must have known deep down that this conversation would have to happen one day, given my condition.
I trust you, and I like you, so I’m just going to come out with it, okay?
I have no right to ask, really, but I need to know.
If I turned, completely - if the Techrot took me and I wasn’t the Eleanor you knew any more - would you kill me?
Hmm. Good start. You’ve made it about what I want instead of seeing my life as an opportunity to flex your personal morals. You just let me know that this isn’t about you.
Wow. Okay.
Okay. Um.
As you wish.
That’s rare.
No hesitation, no struggle, just a simple yes.
Sorry. I'm actually a little overwhelmed. I didn't expect you to be that forthright.
I won't ask again.
Unfortunately it doesn’t get us out of our dilemma, because it means I never get to change my mind.
Thank you. You're an enigma to me in many ways, but now I know you'd be willing to put a bullet through my head, and that sort of thing is important in the workplace.
You'd let the monster live?
I suppose we'll have to wait until it happens to see how you react, won't we?
Let’s say I say yes, I’d want you to end me quick and clean rather than for me to go on living as a ravening freak. Let’s say that’s what Eleanor wants NOW.
Aaaand I just felt the Techrot in my cells give an anxious little quiver.

Sorry, sorry, it's just that I've been living every day with Lettie in my ear crowing about how I don't deserve to be here and Arthur looking at me like I'm a lost cause and he's counting the days till he has to do it, and I just didn't expect you to say that ok
You're a lethal little enigma.
But what if the ravening freak is me, only more so? What if, once my humanity burns away in the Techrot crucible, I don’t WANT to die?
I think it's going to behave itself a little better from now on. Nothing like threatening the host to put the fear of Sol into the parasite, eh?
Crying. Happy tears. Talk soon. Please
And so am I.
Because it makes me feel alive, Drifter. Powerfully alive.
Okay. So we're sacrificing happy, empowered Eleanor on the altar of Eleanor as she used to be?
Oh, so all I'd need to do is blink my big beautiful eyes at you and your resolve would crumble?

Ah. Right. In this scenario, I’m an inhuman monster who’s presumably slaughtering people willy-nilly. You get to put me in the ‘predatory animal’ category, along with rabid dogs and hungry bears and such, which means there’s no moral quandary.
… I don’t know. Some days I think so. I feel like the stock character from a melodrama.
I can change my mind and decide to live, but you can't change yours?
What kind of fearless vampire killer would you be then?
So tell me.
“Oh no, the hapless girl we once loved has become a sexy vampire. Let us kill her so that in death she will become pure and innocent once again.”
Do you wait until I claim my first victim before you pop a bullet through my skull?
Because if you don’t, how can you be sure I’m a danger?

I obsessed over it, actually. I had nightmares where I’d wake up on my couch and Arthur would be standing over me, tears in his eyes and sword in his hand, and he’d grate out some line about how Eleanor was his sister but now Eleanor was GONE, and he had to do this even though it was killing him, boo hoo.
I shouldn't be surprised. It's the ending the stories prepare you for.
I'll tell you. You'll be the kind who dies halfway through the movie, because they didn't have the heart to Do What Had To Be Done.
“Oh no, the hapless girl we once loved has become a sexy vampire. Let us kill her so that in death she will become pure and innocent once again.”
You'll be a warning to the others, you will!
Sorry. I'm not being very fair with you. Talk soon.

I obsessed over it, actually. I had nightmares where I’d wake up on my couch and Arthur would be standing over me, tears in his eyes and sword in his hand, and he’d grate out some line about how Eleanor was his sister but now Eleanor was GONE, and he had to do this even though it was killing him, boo hoo.
And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.
And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.
Maybe I'll dream about you next.
O Drifter! O vagabond of time and space! How welcome your presence is on this little screen of mine!
Hey matey.
Guess what.
Ugh. I’m so tediously bloody predictable.
... you'd like that, wouldn't you?
Alas, no. My bottom has not been improved by the addition of a tail. It cannot be improved, for it is already perfect.
Yes, I do. Yet another one. But this is a really big one, so bear with me, okay?
However, I did have a question for you.
Good. Great. So.

How do relationships work in your time? I mean, is it all the usual ‘two or more adults get together with varying degrees of solemnization’ stuff? Or are there all sorts of rules about who can be with who?
Gosh.
Right. Of course.

Those two on Deimos, Father and Mother. They’re a married couple. They may be gigantic Infested former Orokin whatnots, but they’re very clearly and painfully MARRIED in exactly the same way my mum and dad are.
From the bits and pieces I've gleaned from your mind, I still see standard pairings of people. Folks who are very clearly and painfully MARRIED in exactly the same way my mum and dad are.
So was that standard for Orokin?
I know you were isolated in Duviri, but I had no idea you were THAT isolated.
Let me try another tack.
I'm sincerely sorry if I've caused you any upset by asking.
Let's see...
Okay. So where you come from, would it be normal for a person to be in a relationship with, say, a Cephalon?
I am trying to ask a THEORETICAL question!
I'm not aching to grind myself against your glassy chum, however charming he may be
Damn. Let me try again.
I'm trying, and failing, to ask you about POWER IMBALANCES
Make up someone from your time who’s both female and dangerous. Strong, too. Like Major Rusalka without the demonic possession.
Okay. Let’s say there’s a Grineer sniper lady and she falls for a human. And it’s mutual. Star crossed lovers. Desperately tragic. Could they be together?
Okay. Let’s say there’s a Dax soldier lady and she falls for a lowly human. And it’s mutual. Star crossed lovers. Desperately tragic. Could they be together?
I’m tying myself in knots here.
Thank you.

Is it normal where you come from for people to get together with partners who are far more powerful and dangerous than they are? Like in ‘Gumbly and the Dragon’s Socks’ when the elf prince ends up married to the giant?
Question: can two people with wildly differing physiques and lethality levels be in a relationship? Answer: yes.
… you don’t know what I’m talking about, do you.
That's all I wanted to know.
I'd better stop. I'm in danger of making a complete berk of myself.
I don’t want to ruin your day. Sorry.
Can I be allowed a self-pitying rant?
I am NOT saying my life is meaningless without someone to share it with
I am NOT defined by who I choose to love
I am sufficient unto myself
BUT HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO EVEN ENTERTAIN THE POSSIBILITY OF A RELATIONSHIP WHEN I COULD LITERALLY KILL SOMEONE BY ACCIDENT IF I GOT CARRIED AWAY
Welcome to Eleanor and her horny mantis problems
If I ever find that Entrati bastard I will turn his balls into earrings. If he has any balls.
OMFS
Yes.
I AM LITERALLY BITING MY TONGUE SO I DON'T LAUGH
The only one of those four I could even CONSIDER dating is Aoi and that's complicated because of Arthur
Bless you for suggesting that but no, not in a million years
You know what I am better than I do, I think. I’m a Protoframe. I’m a partially transformed war machine, and it feels like it’s getting less partial by the day.
Whoever designed poor ‘Nyx’ was building a killer. That’s me, now. Efficient. Lethal. Cuddly as a claymore.
All very well when it comes to the day job, but at the office party who’s going to kiss a walking deathtrap under the mistletoe?
No it hasn’t happened because I haven’t bloody let it. OK?
No partners, no casualties. Not worth the risk.
I hadn't considered that.
I’d rather be lonely than steeped in guilt, thanks.
Our memories persist, though.
I don't think anyone would want to be in a relationship with someone who bit their head off once, even if it got better.
Lua wept. I need a drink now.
Correct. A trade-off I am quite willing to make.
Sorry. I’m not sure talking about this was a good idea.
I think I need to be on my own for a bit.
I think I’ve done it. I broke through. I made contact.
Are you there? Please be there.
Am I going to have to do this over telepathy? Oh God. Please not now.
Ever since you appeared, a question has been pestering me. A question I believe I might've just answered. And dear Sol I don't know what I've done.
You! The question of bloody You. You exist not once but twice.
And if you could exist in another world, as another version of yourself, why couldn't I?
Somewhere out there in the now-confirmed-to-exist vast possible universes was that version of myself that I always wondered if I should become.
The one who turned away from the world to become a nun.
An apostle of Lua sat on a mountaintop somewhere, incense clouds flowering around her.
I've been trying to contact her. Trying to reach through the Void to find her.
The other me. The one who became a nun. I’ve been trying to contact her.
I just did it.

Of course it was never going to work so long as I stayed in this world. I’m already the ‘me’ of this world. I had to go through the roaring whiteness. The blackstar fugue. The leechbone gulf. That’s how you get to the other sides. The maybes and the could-have-beens.
The Void! I saw the Void!
Drifter dear, I admire your ability to use humour as a coping mechanism, but right now I am entirely serious.
I went in with my mind, not my body. That’s the difference.
I did what I set out to do.
I not only saw the Void, I entered it.
Ow headache ow ow ow

That’s how I got into the Void in the first place. Through that memory. The horror was just smoke and through the smoke was a GATE. If I hadn’t been so frightened I would have seen it clearly the first time around.

There’s a feeling there isn’t a word for. You look out on the world and you just KNOW, that all the ordinariness - buildings, cars, people, jobs, work, routine - is just a thin crust over a bottomless horror, and if people ever realized it they’d start screaming and never stop.
Not even a little bit.
I fell through the crust.
Just listen. Please. And try to understand.
It wasn’t emptiness. I could have borne that. It went on and on forever, but it wasn’t just cold space. There was something in there with me.
It tried. I felt it. I knew it was curious, reaching for me.
It’s okay that you’re not convinced. I know this sounds insane. Just hear me out, okay?
I’ll make a deal with you.
First you let me finish telling you what happened.
Once I’m done, you can make your own mind up about whether it was the Indifference messing with me or not. I promise I’ll take you seriously.
Deal?
Excuse me?
I'm not sure what to say. I'm a bit concerned, because you sound so upset, but I didn't realise you cared quite so much.
I'm all right. Please don't worry about me.
I can't promise anything, but I'll try not to scare you again.
So like I was saying. I found her.
I could feel the Indifference watching. I could feel it make a face like one of those dried-out desert mummies as it reached out for me. I reached out for her, and she pulled me through.
She was sitting in the Lotus position in some kind of open-air shrine, next to a pit full of embers. It was nighttime. The moon was dim, ghosting through scrolling clouds.
She put a finger to her lips.
For a second I could feel that giant hand still groping for me. Then it recoiled, like a guillotine had come down on one of its fingers.
Grass whispered. Crickets sang. We were alone.
We sat across the fire-pit from each other. She didn’t speak, but she let me look into her mind, soft and sisterly.
She was so happy, so perfectly content. A woman in the place that was right for her. Callused feet, clear eyes. Breathing the fire and drinking the moon.
No! Just the opposite!

I didn’t need to take that path, because she already had. Don’t you see? I’m free now. I never need to wonder ‘what if’ because there already IS a Sister Eleanor. She’s got my back. Am I making sense?
Oh yeah. I’ve never been more certain of what to do next.
I’m going to take the life she freed me up to live, and live it to the hilt.
Oh Gods, yeah. We were thick as thieves for a while.
That's a little personal, mate, but I'll allow it. You've been with us a while. You deserve to know the lay of the land.
Someone not a million miles away, you mean?
That was before Entrati, of course.
Apart from Arthur and Aoi dating? No. Not that I know about, anyway... and I WOULD know.
Don't answer that.

Now she acts like I’m a different person. Convenient for her. If I’m not really Eleanor then she can be as hurtful towards me as she wants, because she’s not hurting the person she knew. I think it’s cowardly.
And in case you're thinking about making a move on any of us...
If I thought they knew what they were doing and had genuine feelings for the guy, I'd be thrilled. Obviously.
... you could do worse than earn Quincy's trust. He sees a lot. Maybe you could take notes.
But I'd want to make sure they knew how easy it is to hurt him.
What are those robot things that are all armour and attitude on the outside but the inside is all soft, squishy organics?
It doesn't matter. The point is, Arthur's like one.
Oh, come on. I’ll grow wings and a tail before THAT happens.
Entrati has buggered off. If there was ever a hope of getting the old Eleanor back, the one who sang in the shower and smiled at kids in the street, that hope left with him.
If he lets you in, for Sol's sake be gentle with him.
Are you trying to get on my good side?
YOU WOULD THINK.
I mean, yes. She does.
Lettie adores Arthur. He’s the big brother she never had. If Arthur wasn’t around, I’d wake up to a chloroform rag over my mouth and end up at the bottom of the river.
I still haven't forgiven her for what she said about letting this city burn.
She thinks he’s delusional, holding on to the past. But she loves the guy and she’s a good soldier, so she’ll never go against him.
Even Aoi was shocked. It makes you wonder who the real monsters are, doesn't it?
It’s complicated. There’s more than one reason.
She’s told me to her face that I’m not to go poking around in her head. If I didn’t agree, she’d leave the Hex and take her chances on her own. Insane stuff.
So part of it is just that she’s scared I’m going to read her teenage diary, as it were. I’ll peer at her most embarrassing secrets and laugh my arse off and she’ll be humiliated forever.
The truth is, I’m just not that curious. Whatever sick little secret she’s hiding from me, it’s safe.
Do you think I'd kiss and tell?
It’s crossed my mind.
No. No we didn't.

I’d have been up for it, I think. Nothing wrong with a snog and a grope between friends, especially if Arthur had to give us an awkward speech at briefing about how we mustn’t let our feelings get in the way of doing our job.
Which is just as well, because can you imagine how awkward things would be between us now?
It blows off steam, it’s good for morale, and it’s cheap.
I mean... I wouldn't have said no. It just never came up.
But whatever Ms Garcia is hiding is something people could use to hurt her. So I’m a threat, because I might see it in her head.
So if you're attracted to her, then go for it! I'll cheer from the sidelines! Lua knows Lettie could use some happiness in her bleak, loveless life.
Why? You got designs on my brother? Or on Aoi?
Oh! Oh! DO tell...
Interesting.
하하하
I KNEW IT.
I don't blame you one bit.
I don't have the heart to tell you what you're letting yourself in for. You can walk that road all by yourself.
Just so we're clear: baiting Arthur is MY prerogative. And if you're ever cruel to him on purpose, I will murder you. One more thing...
I know she seems too pure to be real, but believe me, she's a soldier like the rest of us.
Get to know the REAL Aoi, not whatever image you have in your head of her, and you'll be okay. Also...
Arthur and Aoi’s relationship was one of the first casualties of this conflict. Neither one of them is over it. It’s a bit of an open wound, so be careful.
Why are you asking?
Hmm. I don't agree.
Aoi's my friend. And however much of a prat Arthur may be, he's still my brother.
I'm not sure I should be confiding anything in you.
Okay. I don’t know what THEY would tell you, but from where I’m sitting, they were just pulling in different directions.
They’re both romantics, just different kinds. Arthur wants the cottage with the roses around the door. He claims he doesn’t, but he does.
Gods, he even used to talk about taking over a pub sometime. I can just see him with his little crowd of regulars, pulling pints, making Sunday roasts, full of hard-won wisdom.
Can you see Aoi finding a place in a dream like that? I can’t. She needs to spread her wings.
Well, you're not alone.
But you don't go up to grieving people and say 'I told you so'. You rally round. I did my best to comfort Arthur, and Lettie tried to patch up Aoi's broken heart.
Tread lightly. That's all I'm saying.
Sorry, that's probably not the response you were hoping for, is it?
Well.
We'll see.
Rugged, dashing Arthur? Pure, kindhearted Aoi? Neither one of them floats your boat?
I am intrigued.
We shall talk of this another time, she said, wrapping her crimson cape around her face and stalking away...
The Kingdom you used to rule over. Duviri. You didn’t invent it, did you?
However did you achieve that?
Oops. My mistake.
Angels? In this time, angels are thought of as benevolent creatures. Terrifying, sometimes, but on the side of good. Unless you mean the fallen ones.
That was thoughtless of me, wasn't it? The place wasn't exactly a holiday camp for you.
I'm sincerely sorry. I'll keep my curiosity under control from now on.
I see. I can’t imagine something called a ‘Void Angel’ swooping down and blessing a newborn babe.
The future, as you describe it, sounds bloody horrible.
I can’t blame you for wanting to hide away from these Void Angels. Especially if they were…
Oh. I just got a feeling. They weren’t your parents, were they?
I’m so sorry. I’m glad you found safe harbour, even if it didn’t stay that way.
But how on earth did you do it? You were only a child. What gave you the power to conjure an entire kingdom out of nothing?
When I was five, I wanted to be a witch. I yelled Abracadabra and jumped from the top of the stairs. I didn't know I couldn't fly. But I quickly found out.
The power to create Duviri must have come from somewhere other than you. You used it to do something incredible, but it wasn't yours.
Not at first, anyway. It's in you now, though. The wild energy. The loops in time. Gods, you're a wonder.
I SEE. So if you looked into the Void with… hmm, let’s say ‘hunger’… you might create a prowling half-starved wolf. Or a royal banquet, maybe. Or a loaf of bread with wolf’s teeth gnashing in it.
What a terrifying, exhilarating thought.
Whyever did the Orokin think it was a good idea to launch a ship full of children into the Void? Wasn’t that an emotional time bomb waiting to go off?
Ugh. Sorry, but you’ve ruined it for me now.

Why can’t stories just be stories? I HATED it when I found out that Rudolfo the Leopard King who died heroically in battle with the Zodiac Serpent was meant to be Sol with his sun-spots, suffering on the star-tree.
Smuggling religion into kids’ books is like hiding medicine inside sweeties. JUST TELL THEM.
I can die a happy woman knowing that those books get forgotten about. Hurrah for the future!
Ugh. Please, no. It's not a real legend, it's a terrible series of children's books.
You do have stories, though, don’t you?
I could tell you some of our real legends, though, if you like.
Well, that’s boggled my noggin. You’re from the far future, but you’ve also been out of the loop in Duviri for so many years that events that happened in your lifetime have had time to become myths?
I’m getting vertigo.
You're a storybook character yourself, aren't you?
Blimey. We’ll be here all year if I start.
Let’s see. There’s Arthur, of course. Good old Arthur. The original. Britannia’s finest.
Trapped in a magical kingdom where time flows differently, summoned to the place where you were most needed...
Then there’s Young Loxley. I loved her. Wanted to be her. She was the model for a certain kind of young woman.
All we need to round your story off is a love interest, or a slavering, inhuman monster.
(Or a slavering, inhuman love interest, depending on how your tastes run.)
Okay. Potted version: she was the daughter of a nobleman back in ye olde days, when the land was suffering under a cruel King.
Her brother had been killed off fighting in foreign climes, but word hadn’t reached home yet, so when the poor oppressed people needed a hero she rose to the occasion.
And that's fine, honestly.
Monstrosity is in the eye of the beholder, my friend.

If you are sincerely drawn to the qualities you think 'monstrous' in another, then you had better make sure they share your choice of labels and revel in it. Otherwise, you commit the grossest fetishization.
Would I call myself a monster, for example? Yes. Enthusiastically. I take the title others would condemn me by, and I rejoice in it. In case you were wondering.
Monsters are used to being alone.
We're survivors.
Now, normally I can't stand hero figures. They're toxic. Infectious, and for that reason, dangerous.
Young Loxley's different.
She gets a pass. Shut up.

As I was saying. She looked a lot like her brother, so she dressed up in his old clothes and pretended to be him, and went off to lead a revolution. If anyone got too close they might notice she was a girl, so she took to wearing a hood. It became her trademark.
She was shit-hot with a bow and arrow. She and her crew became this beloved band of outlaws, robbing from the King’s tax collectors and giving the money to whoever needed it most.

That’s history for you. Back then, men supposedly did all the fighting, so they did the ruling too. People expected to take orders from men. She needed to draw on her brother’s reputation to do what she had to do. It was that or go under.
So am I.

It depends which version of the story you read. She either got called straight to the Hall of Heroes, or married the King’s wayward daughter, or got trapped in an oak tree where she sleeps to this day waiting for Britannia’s hour of need.
Not if that Ballas character is anything to go by, you didn't.
Gods, I'd love to see your era with my own eyes. Maybe you could smuggle me back one of those icebox coffin things and I can just sleeeeeep for a few millennia.
Hence the saying back home. If things are going badly, like they were during the war, it’s tradition to shrug and say ‘Well, it can’t be THAT bad. Young Loxley’s not turned up yet.’
How much bloody longer do we need? FFS.

Oh, I’ve always loved them. When I was little, my dad took us to the Innovation Museum in Ludston and Arthur and I both got these crystal growing kits. Arthur’s turned out shit, literally like a lumpy little rock turd. It went in the bin. Mine was a beautiful blue diamond. Ever since that day I’ve felt like crystals were on my side, somehow.
Okay, I'm feeling generous today, so I'll give you this one for free.
We have never. We have not even slightly.
I cannot help thinking that Quincy's preferred position would be 'partner on top holding a mirror, so he can imagine he's having sex with himself'.
No thank you. I'm content to admire from afar.
Ah. No.
I know there’s a lot of nonsense written about crystals. Not my thing. I don’t believe they purify my aura or light up my chakras.
But they do have a presence.
Sorry. I’m aware I sound like a complete headcase.
Oh you are MADDENING sometimes.
Well, now I feel stupid for feeling stupid.
Amazed and intrigued!
I would have thought that you, of all people, could lift your perspective above the purely material.
Away with you. Leave me to my fancy rocks.
I expect you have crystals I could only dream about.
Tell me, wise traveller, of the crystals of your time.
You say ‘you only find it in the Void’ like people are popping in and out of the Void all the time. I thought it was this crazy-making dimension, not a seaside resort.
That's her name? I think I glimpsed her in your mind!
How beautiful and sad. What must it be like, to become a monument to your love?
The pretty geode lady. I suppose she and I are related now. There's a comforting thought.
I hope nobody chips little bits off them as a keepsake. That would definitely happen in my time.

Now that’s familiar. There are these top-security bunkers under Ludston and Mancunia. The idea is, if there’s ever a Radiation War, the fat cats and bigwigs get to hide down in their luxury bolthole and sip Mimosas while the rest of us get burned to a cinder up above.
Same old story, she said with a sigh.

It’s funny. Everyone was so scared of a Radiation War when I was growing up. I remember the public service broadcasts that used to go out. Sombre advice about how to stockpile supplies, how to prepare a refuge room, and how you really have to bury any dead relatives even if you don’t want to.
When I saw the reactor exploding in your mind, it took me right back to all those nightmares. I knew we had to stop it, whatever it took. I’d make the others believe you.

It’s not a Radiation War that’s waiting for this planet, though, is it? It’s the Techrot. One way or another, this loop’s going to work itself out and when it does, the rest of the world’s going to get infected.
I wanted to ask you something, but I’m not sure how you’ll take it, so if I’m out of order please say so.
What were your parents like?
I'm sorry. I stupidly assumed that because your memories of the Zariman were so vivid, you'd be able to recall your parents, too.
I forget how many lifetimes you've lived.
I'm glad. If you don't mind me saying so, it shows.
There's a warm flame of kindness in you, and I was wondering who had helped to kindle it.
I didn't think you'd had a soft upbringing. I suppose colonists need to be tough.
With those Orokin in charge, it's a wonder anyone turned out decent.
Oh dear. Well, for what it's worth, you made a bloody decent human being of yourself.
I only wish you could have had an easier time of it.
No, I'm sorry. I had no right to ask.
I was thinking about mine. I do it a lot, actually. I sit on my arse and wonder what Mum and Dad would think about how their kids ended up.
As people they were radically mismatched, which means they had the kind of relationship that burns hot and bright for the first few years and then collapses into a sucking black hole after that.

Incompatible, in a word. Dad wanted us to be independent, so he'd engineer situations where we had to be. Dropping us off in the woods with just a penknife, that sort of thing. Mum was always coming to the rescue. It was doomed.

Dad is ex-army. Jovial, little wrinkly eyes, speaks like a newsreader, so broken on the inside that if you picked him up and shook him he’d rattle like a bag of gravel. He’s surprisingly easy to upset. I’ve tossed off comments that I thought were mild, then overheard him crying in the loo later on.
Arthur and I quickly learned to play them off against one another. You know how kids are.

Mum’s lot were richer, which meant she had a long leash. She didn’t go down the party path, wine and drugs and weeklong binges in Ludston flats. That was more Aunt Janice’s gig. Mum is more flowers, pottery hedgehogs, pot-pourri and everything being Nice.
Parents always overcompensate for whatever they feel their own parents did wrong, don't they?

Well, they’re divorced now. They waited until we were out of our teens to do it, out of ‘consideration’. That was kind, don’t you think? Forcing us to live in a bloody battleground of a house because Kids Need Stability or some such garbage.

Once in a while. We used to go back home for Solstice. Now that I do miss. Decorating the star-tree, crowning Sol, little kids going door to door dressed as Lua’s Three Aspects, roasting the bird… it’s sentimental, but I genuinely love it.

Mum and Dad always had a peace treaty for Solstice and they always respected it. On a good year they managed to keep from ripping into each other until after Third Day, even with the plum brandy flowing.
If you just felt a massive wave of homesickness wash over you, that was me. Sorry.
I try to keep the big emotions to myself but sometimes they just boil over like milk in a pot, and everyone cops it. Then it’s on to the old KIM for a round of apologies.
I was just wondering what they’d make of you. If we ever get out of this place, I’d like to rock up to Solstice dinner with my time-traveling friend.
I think you’d like it. You and Dad and Arthur could sit by the fire and trade war stories, and Mum could gently prod you about whether you were single.
HA! That just makes me want to do it more.
That's so sweet of you!
Oh Gods, let's do it. If we ever get the chance, we'll make it real.
Um.
I can just see Dad politely asking "so was it always death by impalement, or did they try to vary it up a bit?"
... I should let go of this dream before I try to make it happen. We are here, this is now, and there's still a war on.
Thank you.
This took a turn, she said, fanning herself.
I'm going to dream about this. Thank you.
Thank you for a beautiful dream.
I've got one more thing to get out of bed in the morning for, now.
Would you WANT to?
You are an absolutely exasperating person.
I’m trying to have a perfectly innocent conversation about parents, with no ulterior motive, and now you’ve gone and knocked me sideways.
Right.
Sorry.
Yes.
By all means.
I'm going to have to give this the serious consideration it deserves. FFS.
My mistake.
We have time, and none of us is going anywhere, are we?
Yes. The one you said was going to be a waste of time, and that you were only playing out of pity for him, that's the one, isn't it?
He's a charming little imp. Why are you asking?
As much as the next person, I suppose. Why are you asking?
Which one of us is no longer "too cool" for the game, exactly? You or I?
Ah. I see. You are the chosen messenger, sent from the Thunderbolt King to enlist fair Eleanor. No doubt all sorts of roguery await me. Fol de rol and so forth.

We've all been there at one point in our lives... trying to wear a mask to impress someone and falling flat on our face because we can't see where we're going. And you and I had barely met when you asked. All right. You're forgiven.
I will do you a favour and NOT convey those words along to him. Word to the wise: treat him with more respect in the future in my presence.
Honestly, putting on a daft voice and play-acting for a few hours sounds ideal. Count me in.
Oh! I would like to be a wizard. Or perhaps a bard. Or perhaps both? Can you BE both?
Or I could be a swamp hag! So long as I get to wear a tight bodice, mind. Mother Mossytits will eat your bones, little manikin.
Hello, dearheart. I’m feeling a bit on the melancholic side. Do you have a moment?
Hello. I’m feeling a bit on the melancholic side. Do you have a moment?
Thank you, sincerely.
Do you know who the Hooded Woman is?
Hah. Speaking to our dear Lettie, I see. Yes.
Not quite.
Yes, actually.

She’s Death. Also one of the Aspects of Lua, depending on which tradition you follow. She’s the one who comes and tucks you into bed once the knockabout day of Life is over, kisses you goodnight, and sings you to sleep.
Mate. Everything Entrati gave us, the power, the strength, the armour plated arses… I’d trade it all for one crumb of reassurance that death isn’t the end.
... it was going to be.
Forget it. I'm sure you have more important things to do.

I’ve tried. I don’t feel good about admitting this, but sometimes when we’ve been out on patrol and there’s been fighting, I look into the minds of the dying and try to go through the process with them. If there’s any light at all at the end of the tunnel, I just want to see it.
I know. I KNOW.
I tell myself I was trying to help but the truth is I just wanted to see. You're right. It was ghoulish.
I did, once. What’s the harm, right? They’re dying anyway. It was this young Scaldra trooper. She was coming for me and I shot her in the chest.

I knelt down by her side as she gargled out her lifeblood and tried to tell her it was okay, the pain was coming to an end, soon she’d be with her family who had gone before, all the placid, pacifying stuff you think of when there’s a deathbed service to be held.

She was terrified. What was left of her conscious self was scrabbling around like a rat in a water tank. When she felt me in her mind with her, she tried to cling on. She begged me to help. Underneath it all was this… I don’t even know what you’d call it…
Denial. She didn’t believe she could be dying. And why would she? She’d always been there before. How could death be taking her away now?

Every day of your life, you take YOURSELF for granted. You’re there when you wake up and you’re there when you sleep. You live out your entire life in a house made of You. You never once go outside, because you can’t.
Then one day, you hear the house being knocked down.
What would you have had me do? Call Lettie over? Heal the gaping chest wound? All because I saw what this one was going through, up close?
Yeah. I was scared shitless. As she felt herself slipping over the edge, I was sure I’d be dragged down with her. I could feel this undertow tugging at me.
With the Scaldra it's kill or be killed. They don't offer us the luxury of mercy.
I had to stay, though. I couldn’t abandon her to die alone.
Though I guess she did, in the end. I couldn’t take that last step with her.
I learned nothing.
No.

She did, though. She saw her mother’s face, the kids she went to school with, her cat, some cousin who drowned. But they weren’t presences, or spirits. Just memories, forced to the surface by a dying brain desperately hunting for something to cling to.

Then the house of her identity began to come apart around her. Right before she died, she opened her eyes wide. I think in that second, for the first time in her life, she truly understood what death actually is.
Look. Next time you feel the need to call me out on my bullshit, don't feel you have to sit through it first.
No. We think we know what it is, but all of our experiences are from the outside.
Nobody's forcing you to talk to me. Bye.

Her whole life she was like a woman living in a house with no lights, and all she had was a flashlight. She’d shine the light of her awareness on one spot or another. A memory, a task, an interaction.
She’d move from room to room, explore the cellars in her sleep, but always it would be a closed, finite process. Do you follow me?

Then when the house was demolished and her persona fell to pieces around her, suddenly the flashlight wasn’t shining on a wall or a book or a couch. It was shining up into the infinite sky. Her awareness blazed into the endless without the obstacle of herself standing in the way.
I've tried to tell myself that, many times.
I can't believe it was nothing more than the brain shutting down. It felt like the soul breaking free.

I know it doesn’t make any kind of sense. It feels so counterintuitive, the idea that we are a point of view first and a personality second. All I know is that’s how it felt to be with a human soul as it passed from life to death.
Look. Next time you feel the need to call me out on my bullshit, don't feel you have to sit through it first.
Nobody's forcing you to talk to me. Bye.
Comforted? I like the idea that something of us survives. I love thinking that death isn’t about being deleted from the universe, but having everything deleted that separates you from the universe.
I know.
Honestly, this is why I wanted to talk to you about void ghosts and Cephalons and all of that stuff from your time. I need to know if we ever get the chance to communicate with people we’ve lost.
Real communication, not some hologram crap. The kind that lets you know definitively what the person thought.
I see. Maybe there are some doors we can never open. Maybe that's for the best.
His name was Christopher. He was Arthur’s best friend.
We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.
I’m sorry. I can’t do this. I’ll talk to you another time.
Right. I’m calm and as ready as I’ll ever be.
Can I talk to you about Christopher?
Arthur's best friend. We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.
Thank you.
Because he’s someone I lost. Someone who was very dear to me.
Since you and I are a lot closer now (in so many delightful ways) you should really know what who you're getting involved with.
Please correct me if I’m wrong, but lately I’ve been feeling like you and I are more than just teammates.
I've seen inside your head, but you've not seen inside mine.
So, please brace yourself and bear with me.
You've made it pretty plain to me how you feel, which I appreciate.
We’re definitely friends. Maybe more than that. But we’re still pacing uncertainly around one another and waiting for the other one to make the first move.
I like you, very much. I trust you. You’ve had plenty of opportunities to treat me like a freak, like Lettie does, and you haven’t done it. Don’t think I haven’t noticed.
I want to tell you about Christopher because I think you deserve to know.
There's a time to bail on a conversation with a friend. This was not it.
He was older than Arthur and me by a few years. I can’t remember a time when he wasn’t around. Our parents were friends, so he was always over.

He used to play at soldiers with Arthur in the scabby patches of woodland down behind the estate. Christopher was the commander, Arthur the loyal lieutenant. If they ever let me play, I had to be the nurse. Obviously.

I wish Dad had looked out at Arthur throwing himself on yet another pinecone grenade, dying valiantly to save his CO, and thought ‘hmmm, my boy’s getting a bit too fond of this Army lark, maybe I should tell him getting shot up isn’t as much fun as he thinks.’
Our paths crossing was a rare blessing in my life, yes.
In some respects, yes.
Probably not. He’d just have seen it as Dad testing him.
But I was trying to tell you about a bereavement here.
But allow me to wish it had not come at such a cost.
Especially when I haven't yet told you how deep the wounds go.
Not really the time to look for silver linings.

Anyway. Summer after summer rolled past. We grew to be adolescents. It was all very awkward and smelly and hormonal. There were parties and exams. Christopher went off to college. The dog died, we got a new one. Insert montage here.
Suddenly one day I walked into the kitchen, I saw this stunning young man in uniform in front of me, and I thought ‘phwoar’ for the second time in my life.
'Pwhoar'?
It's a traditional Britannic expression of admiration. It should be delivered in a sort of low growl, puffing the cheeks out.

Mandy Jellicoe. My crush. She dropped out of school, dyed her hair, got piercings, hung around town in a leather jacket smoking cigarettes and glowering at anyone who came too close. I looked at her and I could feel my bones melt.
Anyway. NOT RELEVANT.
Yep. He was kind. Gorgeous. Strong. Easy to wind up, too, which was a big plus. Hell-bent on joining the army, though.

We didn’t see eye to eye on that. To him it was a calling. He’d be out there helping people who needed it, making a difference in the world. He’d bought into the whole manly hero line, just like Arthur.
Yes. I hate what it did to Christopher, what it's still doing to Arthur, what it does to so many like them.
I have nothing against morals. Gods know I even have a few myself. But the whole hero narrative is pernicious bullshit.
You can fight for a better world without buying into the hero bullshit!
The whole point of the Hero Virus is that it's a virus. IT DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THE HOST. It convinces you hat dying in a cause would be fitting and noble, instead of being a tragic bloody waste.

‘Why do you want to go and kill people in the name of a Prince who couldn’t give a shit about you?’ I’d say to him. He’d be hurt, because it wasn’t supposed to be about His Majesty’s Service. For him it was about taking out warlords who hoarded food and forced their political prisoners to work in the Rubedo mines until they died of exhaustion.
I was confident I’d be able to talk Christopher out of his military service. If not talk, then snog him out of it.
... not really the time.
This isn't easy for me so please choose your moment a bit better
Yes, and?
I was trying to save his life. I was willing to fight as dirty as it took.
Do I need to spell it out?
I got caught up in the very web I was trying to spin.
Right. By then, of course, it was too late. I’d gone into this thinking I’d bewitch him, but the truth is, he bewitched me.
I’m sorry. I’m not going to be able to get through this without crying, so if I’m slow in responding, at least you’ll know why.
I told him I was pregnant. He offered to marry me. Stupid beautiful idiot.
No. But I thought I was. I didn’t try to trick him, if that’s what you were asking.
Arthur was skipping on fluffy clouds, he was so happy. The guy he saw as a brother was going to be his brother-in-law.

Then everything goes into fast-forward. Something about a pre-emptive strike. Borders and containment, risk of escalation, moral bloody mandate. Christopher’s deployed, Arthur’s already signing up, all the boys are off to the Crimson Watch and my mum’s still trying to arrange the wedding seating.
They killed him. The people we were supposedly there to help. They blew his vehicle apart with a bomb made from fertilizer and masonry nails.
I tell myself ‘at least it was quick’. ‘At least he didn’t suffer.’ But for all I know, he died screaming with nails in his eyes
Shit
Shitting shit
I feel like you haven't paid attention to a SINGLE THING I've been saying to you here
I'm not interested in 'at least...' He died in a STUPID way for a STUPID reason
I cried of course but all the time I was thinking ‘what did you expect, you STUPID girl, you KNEW what you were getting into, you KNEW this was going to happen’
Telling you about it like this, it just feels like corny folk song shit
My love he is gone off to war, sing fol de rol de dee, oh no he’s dead, I shall wander in the lonesome valleys and never wed another
And if you aren't listening to me when I talk about this, what else aren't you hearing? As charming as this has all been between us I... no. This was a mistake.
And if you aren't listening to me when I talk about this, what else aren't you hearing?
This whole bloody thing was a mistake. We're through.
Sorry. Get it together, Eleanor.
I think he’d have liked you.
Got to go tidy myself up. Talk again soon.
Sometimes I have to ask myself why you’re still here.
Oh Gods. Sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I'm just having trouble seeing MYSELF as the reason you'd tolerate all... this.
... are we talking about the same people here?
I mean… we know what we’re doing now. We’re containing the spread. You’ve done what you were sent to do. You don’t HAVE to stay. And yet…
Oh, don't get cryptic. I'll feel compelled to worm the information out of you somehow.
... wait, did you just leave?
Well, now I’m wondering what I did to trick you. Or manipulate you. Maybe I put some kind of suggestion in your head.
And I thank the Gods for the day you joined us.

Well, now I’m wondering what I did to trick you. Or manipulate you. Maybe I put some kind of suggestion in your head. Or maybe there’s a secondary Techrot virus in your system that’s attracted to what’s in mine.
I'm glad you found what you were looking for. All rivers find their way to the sea, eventually.
Or maybe there’s a secondary Techrot virus in your system that’s attracted to what’s in mine.
Or maybe (deep breath) you actually like me the same way I like you. Could it really be that simple?
As families go, this one's a mess. But I wouldn't change it for the world.

I’ll make a deal with you. Go and see Lettie, ask her to run you through a quick psych-eval, get to the bottom of whatever’s REALLY going on here, and we’ll just forget this conversation ever happened.
See? That was easy.
OF COURSE I FEEL THE SAME WAY
YOU ARE THE BEST THING THAT EVER BLOODY HAPPENED IN MY ABSURD LIFE
WHICH MEANS YOU’RE NOT GOING TO BE PART OF IT FOR LONG AND THE SOONER WE BOTH ADMIT THAT THE BETTER
BECAUSE THAT’S HOW IT WORKS
No. We’re not alone, are we? And we never have to be.
Right. I can see you've made your mind up.

I could come up with a dozen different reasons why we shouldn’t be together, and you’d have an answer for every one of them. Oh, what if I infect you? You’re immune. What if I try to eat you? You’re functionally immortal. What if I see inside your head? I’m sure you’d just kick me out again.
You wonderful, impossible creature. You’ve only gone and won me over, you have.
Oh, one last thing. I don’t know if you’ve noticed, but I have this embarrassing personal problem. We do need to address it.
"I love to watch you sleeeep..."
That's more embarrassing for OTHER people.
Well I’m not talking about the size of my arse am I?
No. I'm referencing my tongue. The anaconda in the room.
Yes, the tongue. The anaconda in the room.
Tell me, honestly. How do you feel about it?
So... I'm not the first tentacle-tongued woman you've flirted with? Actually, don't answer that. I'm scared to learn the answer.
Right.
Oh! I see! You imagined you were doing me a favour!
Well. That’s that settled, then.
I appreciate your honesty.

I’m scared. Excited. Nervous. Frankly, more than a little aroused. Might be getting ahead of myself there.

So help me, I do love how bewildered you are sometimes.
Dear? If you're there, I could use your ear.
If you’re there, I could use a friend.
I’m having the Arthur dreams again. The ones where he has to kill me.

I keep having this terrible dream about Arthur where he has to kill me. And as he shoves the blade between my ribs I’m screaming “Eleanor is RIGHT HERE, you stupid bastard!” but he can’t hear me any more.
That’s just it, though. ‘You’re not my sister any more.’ That’s what he says in the dream. Then he stabs me through the chest with his toy sword.
We’re only little kids in the dream, if it wasn’t already messed up enough.
Not even to ‘put me out of my misery’? Not even if I was suffering?
Yeah. That's the worst part.
It's so vivid, so real. Like I'm remembering something that actually happened.
I can't. He’s his father’s son. He’s all about doing the right thing, not the easy thing.
He’s his father’s son. He’s all about doing the right thing, not the easy thing.
I'm sure. The future is quite inventive in its cruelty.
Everything.
But my concern here is with the past.
It’s one of the many, many things we don’t talk about.
I'm not.
I'm honestly trying my best to explain.
My father set the example for the way Arthur and deal with issues between us. Or rather, the way we don't.
We don’t talk about what happened in Cavona, we don’t talk about Christopher and we NEVER talk about Granny Callie.
Maybe I shouldn't.
Maybe I should.
Maybe it’s time.
Do you want the whole story? Or shall I boil it down to essentials?
Granny Callie was desperately sick. Demented. Our father suffocated her to death with a pillow rather than let her go on suffering. I hope that's curt enough for you.
Granny Callie was our paternal grandmother. Callista Penrose Nightingale.

She had Pelham’s Syndrome. You’ve probably cured it by now (she said with an inward wrench). It chips away at a person’s mind. Instead of watching someone you live die all at once, they fade away slowly, by degrees, like an old photograph parching in the sunlight, or a video copied too many times over.

When she first came to live with us, Arthur and I were so excited. To us, she was the lovely old woman who smelled of violets and told stories where she did all the different voices. She gave us actual folding money on our birthdays. We thought it would be like a birthday all the time.

Then she started to go downhill. At first she was just forgetful. Then she started confusing us with other people. She called me Albertine and Arthur, Charlie. Demanded to know where Jimmy had run off to. We never found out whether Jimmy was a dog or a cat or a boyfriend.
Then she started talking to people who weren’t there. Then she started wandering the house after dark.

I remember going for a wee in the middle of the night and seeing her lurching towards me down the corridor in the dark, groaning, her face all twisted up and her hair like a mad clown wig. I couldn’t stop screaming.

When it got really bad, she would lie in bed and shriek. We’d go out to school in the morning and when I turned down our lane, my heart would sink because I could hear her from ten houses away, still screaming, eight hours later.
Our dad used to talk about putting a pillow over her face. We thought he was joking, because of course he was, that’s his mum.

One night she was screaming, and the screams just stopped. I got up and went to Arthur’s room. He was awake, of course. We sat together listening and listening, and then we heard the door to her room close.
Died in her sleep, Dad said the next day.
If he honestly thought it was for the best?
You have no way of knowing that. If Arthur honestly thought it was for the best?
I don’t know. Maybe. It seems a lot less likely now I’ve actually told someone.
You’re wonderful. Thank you for bearing with me. I needed to get that out.
Hello my darling.
Hello, mysterious and oddly compelling stranger from another time.
I haven’t had the Arthur dream once since I told you about Granny Callie. I think you exorcized that demon.
But since we’ve been together, something else has been happening. It’s a bit awkward actually. I’ve been meaning to talk to you about it, but there hasn’t been a good time.
But that's not to say there haven't been OTHER dreams. Rather disturbing ones.
That wouldn't be awkward. This is.
Gods, I wish. Nothing so pleasant, I'm afraid.

Well, maybe if I were a full Warframe, the Techrot wouldn't see me this way. As it is, my cells are still fizzling, and it sees me as its own.
Well, maybe if I were a full Warframe, the Techrot wouldn't see me this way. As it is, my cells are still fizzling, and it sees me as its own.
Isn’t it bizarre? The jilted ex!
Yes. It wants me back in its gang.
Where I come from, you’d have to go and have a fight with it round the back of the local supermarket. I’m not sure how it works in your time.
This is your REAL family, it whispers. Become part of us again, severed sister. Be accepted.
Oh Gods, this is the awkward bit.
The dreams I mentioned before? I'm certain the Techrot's sending them.
Whatever that stuff has that passes for a mind, it’s always been able to connect with mine. The thoughts it sends are always so crude and weak I can easily fend them off.
Most of the time it just feels like this frantic scratching at the back of my skull, like when you’re in the loo and there’s a cat trying to get the door open.
Right. My defenses are down, and it can reach me.
It’s been hitting me on the most primordial level, if you know what I mean. It wants me back. It promises it can make me feel ecstasy I’ve never known.
It will seed my flesh with the dripping cysts of new life. Because it thinks that’s what I want, you see.
Now that's the kind of talk that gets a Drifter absolutely covered with kisses.
I know. I think it knows, too, which is why it's so angry. It can't compete.
I'll sleep easier knowing you have my back.
It’s okay, my sweet. I’m not about to leave you for a suppurating mass of tubercular flesh with lumps of orphaned technology floating in it.
Just… if you see me looking especially dark-eyed and gaunt on any particular morning when we wake up together, please bring me a nice strong coffee and don’t press me for details?
Fancy giving the Techrot something to be REALLY jealous of?
We'll face it together, then. Side by side. Always.
We're family. Blood and found. Unbreakable.
You might notice the Mall feeling a little different this morning.
Nothing big and obvious. Just a few more smiles on a few more faces. A laugh here and there. A sprinkle of happiness on the air.
Just my way of giving back. A telepath can send as well as receive, as you know. It doesn’t have to be a hosepipe jet to one person. It can be more like a fine mist sprayed over an area.
Do you have lawn sprinklers where you come from?
It’ll do.
Yes, my dear, sprinklers. Water sprayers for keeping your lawn nice and damp.
I loved lawn sprinklers when I was a little girl. They were magical. When the sun was brightest, you could catch rainbows in them. You’d run through them and feel a delicious chill all over.
Also ideal for holding your brother's face up to until he screams.
‘Happiness is a lawn sprinkler’. Put that on a greetings card.
I am. And I don’t see why I should keep it to myself. So I’m suffusing the whole Mall with it.
... great. Here I am trying to be the secret happiness fairy sprinkling joy, and instead I get to be the evil drug goblin. My happy mood just nosedived.
Oh! Nice analogy!
Maybe. I hope so. He’s had to put up with so much.
Fine. I'll stop.

So much has changed since you came. I don’t just mean you and me. I mean all of it. Even the Mall.
I’m glad Aoi persuaded me to stay. Bless her.
I didn’t tell you?

Ah. This was not long before you arrived. We’d been out all day trying to stamp out a Techrot hive. There was a murderous tension in the air. Fighting usually burns the anger out of us and leaves us too exhausted to lash out at one another, but this day was different.
I remember Arthur said something like ‘we do this all again tomorrow’ and it hit us all like a sledgehammer. Nobody spoke a word on the ride back to the Mall.
Yes. Usually he manages to hide it, even when he's running on fumes. But I guess he just had nothing left.
He'd burned himself out trying to keep the team together.

I think he was just trying to get us to focus on the job. But I just felt broken. Arthur and Aoi weren’t speaking, Amir was getting on Quincy’s nerves so much I was starting to fear for his life, and Lettie was side-eyeing me every chance she got.
I spent a lot of time looking into mirrors that day. I kept imagining my reflection grabbing me by the throat and hissing ‘YOU are the problem. If it wasn’t for you, none of this would be happening.’
Oh, this wasn't them. This was me. Every pent-up scrap of self-doubt and self-hatred I'd been keeping down came surging up that day.
Thank you. I know you’ve got my back, and it means a lot to me.
I thought to myself: what this group needs is a scapegoat.
I’d heard that line from Lettie so many times, I ended up thinking to myself: maybe she’s right. I’m putting everyone in danger by staying here.
A monster. Someone to blame.
I came up with a whole plan. I’d slip away in the night, hide out in the city somewhere Arthur would never find me, and - this is the part I was most proud of - carry on helping at a distance.
How? Amir can’t trace telepathy.
Trying to guilt me?

I was going to be a noble exile. I’d crouch on rooftops looking all windswept and resolute. I could report on Techrot buildup, let the Hex know where the Scaldra were setting up roadblocks, even act as an emergency comms relay. Every time I saved Lettie’s arse, I’d really make her feel it. Petty? Definitely.
Don't bother. I feel dreadful enough already.
I chose my moment. I waited until Amir was asleep. Then I pulled a long coat on and headed for the garage as silently as I could.
The security grate came down by itself. I turned around and there Aoi was.
We talked all night and cried in each other’s arms. She was hurting, too. Deeply. By the time the sun came up, I’d decided to stay.
Whatever grotesque impulse led you to write that, I hope you choke on it.
Yes. All six of us needed to be here on New Year’s Eve, I think. And you, of course. The stranger at the door, bringing good luck.
Is ‘The Indifference’ what it IS, or what it WANTS?

If it swallows me whole I’ll stick in its throat and choke it.

If this was a story, you’d come up with some clever trick. You’d dig up the giant’s stone heart and crack it with a swan’s feather, or trick it into throwing itself over a cliff.
If those old stories didn’t tell the truth, people wouldn’t have kept telling them.
I don’t mean giants are real. I just mean the old stories tell a different kind of truth.
I know. I wish I had more than instinct to go on.
We're confronting something vast, terrifying and outside our comprehension. Normally only children get to do that. That's why fairy tales exist.
I think the one thing all those giant-killer stories have in common is this: they’re all about learning the rules and figuring out how to be clever with them.
Some monsters are stupid. Some are compelled to be literal. Some have secrets. But you can’t win until you know the rules the monster’s bound by.
Doesn't matter. If it really is stuck, then we can deduce two things, can't we?
It has to be! Even Gods have rules! No matter how powerful the Indifference seems, it’s not a God.
You beat Thrax. It doesn’t matter how many times you failed and ended up on your arse. You WON. Why shouldn’t you beat the Man in the Wall, too?
One, it can be trapped. Maybe even imprisoned.
And two, it WANTS something. It wants to get out. If we know what it wants, we're already one step ahead of it.

I’m going to need help.

Arthur's best friend. We were engaged. I thought I was in love with him.
To... make a very long and tragic story very short... Christopher died in a roadside bomb before we were married.

I’ve been holding on to him for years. So has Arthur. We have a ritual every year in his memory. But not this year. I couldn't face it.
I don’t know whether ghosts exist, but they might as well, because I’ve let him become one.

Everything that I admired about him has just been overshadowed by how he died. I can’t think about him without this knot tightening in my stomach.

Lettie?

그럼, 센티언트인데.
오로킨은 근원계를 다스렸어. 그 중 일부는 영속이라는 의식을 통해 영원히 사는 방법을 찾아냈지.
코퍼스는 그러니까, 로봇을 좋아하고 이윤에 집착하는 재벌 그룹이야. 크레딧을 벌 수 있다면 무슨 짓이라도 하겠지.
유전적으로 변이된 클론들의 세력인데, 원래는 센티언트들과 싸우라고 만들어진 녀석들이야.
센티언트들은 인공 종족인데, 사실 뭐, 이렇게 지각을 가지면 안되는 거였지만, 어쨌든 엄청 오래 전에 오로킨이 만들어냈지.
그 방법이란, 쿠바라는 물건을 써서 자기 의식을 다른 사람의 몸에 집어 넣는 거였어.
지금 코퍼스를 이끄는 건 파보스 그라넘이라고, 오로킨 시대에 가난한 농부로 컸지만 코퍼스 이윤 교단을 창시한 자야.
아, 그러니까 센티언트들은 - 어 대충... 나쁜 놈 정도 위치인 합성 종족인데, 그 중에서 로터스는 빼고. 로터스는 안 나빠. 하지만 로터스는 아르키메디안이었던 마굴리스라는 인물을 기반으로 삼고 있었지.
아, 너한텐 엄청 오래 전이 아니지? 너한텐 미래려나? 아, 어쩄든. 시간 여행이니까.
하지만 이제는 그리니어들이 쿠바를 찾고 있지. 왜냐면 옛 전쟁 동안 오로킨들은 거의 대부분이 말살당했으니까 -- 그리고 오로킨 중에서도 특히 심각하게 뭣 같은 한 놈이 있었는데 -
지금쯤 죽은 지 오래여야 정상이고, 모두 그 작자가 암살당했을 거라고 생각했지만, "그라넘 보이드"란 공간을 탈출해 살아남았으니까 어쩌면 아무도 모르게 미쳤을지도?
어, 그리고 오로킨이라고, 그리니어를 만든 옛날 인종 사람들이 있어. 근원계 전체를 지배하던 게 오로킨이었지. 어쨌든.
어쨌든, 인공 종족이거든. 그래서 오로킨이 살 수 있도록 타우 성계를 테라포밍하라고 보내진 거야. 하지만 녀석들은 오로킨에게 타우에서 살 자격이 없다고 여겼고, 그래서 전쟁을 선포한 거지.
이름은 발라스였거든. 워프레임들의 책임자고, 또 대부분을 만들기도 했어. 엔트라티하고 같이 만들었는데, 역시 오로킨이던가? 하지만 그, 발라스하고, 마굴리스 사이에도 뭐가 있었지.
하지만 한 가지는 확실해. 그 작자는 우주 전체라도 사고 팔려 할 거고, 조금이라도 기회가 닿는 순간 센티언트와 거래를 트려 할 거라는 거야.
그래서, 그리니어들은 느리지만 점점 결함이 늘어만 가는 유전 클론들인데, 얘네들이 섬기는 미친 여왕이 있어서 -
나타만이 생포당해서 루아에서 붙잡혀 있었는데, 발라스가 나타에게 강제로 마굴리스의 형태를 취하게 만들었어. 텐노들을 조종하려고.
